issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

resolution.description: A fix for this issue is checked into the tree and tested.
resolution.name: Fixed

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.
status.name: Resolved

fields.description:
bq. ./hadoop-mapreduce-project/hadoop-mapreduce-client/hadoop-mapreduce-client-jobclient/src/main/java/org/apache/hadoop/mapred/YARNRunner.java:341: public ApplicationSubmissionContext createApplicationSubmissionContext(:3: Method length is 249 lines (max allowed is 150).

{{YARNRunner#createApplicationSubmissionContext}} is longer than 150 lines and needs to be refactored.

comments.body: Attached a simple patch with a refactor that splits the method into 3: setupLocalResources, setupAMCommand and setupContainerLaunchContextForAM. [~ctrezzo] did you mean something like this?
Yes! Thank you [~GergelyNovak] for the patch. Kicking off a QA run.

| (x) *{color:red}-1 overall{color}* |

This message was automatically generated.
Could you please review my latest patch? The only problem [~hadoopqa] found with it was that it doesn't add any new tests - but I don't think that would be necessary for a trivial refactor like this.

Thanks for the updated patch, [~GergelyNovak].  Looks good.  My only quibble is that the summary for the {{@throws IOException}} isn't quite accurate.  The exception happens when 1) any of the many paths cannot be resolved, 2) the tokens cannot be written, or 3) there's a path conflict in the distributed cache artifacts.  Sadly, no succinct way to summarize that.

Thanks [~templedf]. In the codebase most of the javadocs for IOExceptions are left empty (1833/3370), and most of the remaining don't contain anything specific (e.g. "IO problems", "IO failure", "on error", "for any error", etc.). I don't think we can summarize, either. Is it okey if I write 
{{@throws IOException on IO error (e.g. path resolution)}}?
Sounds good to me.
